newsitem.title: USA: Mobil using DDB Needham ads to introduce Speedpass.
newsitem.headline: Mobil using DDB Needham ads to introduce Speedpass.

text.p: Mobil Corp is using an advertising campaign produced by Omnicom Group Inc's DDB Needham to introduce faster gasoline purchases in nine markets across the country this week, Mobil spokeswoman Jeanne Mitchell said Friday.

Mobil calls its technology Speedpass and says customers enrolled in the program will simply wave miniature electronic device attached to their key chains in front of designated gasoline pumps and will be able to immediately fill up and drive away without ever opening wallets or purses for credit cards or cash.

Mitchell said Speedpass is being introduced in and near Boston; Washington, D.C.; Tampa, Fla.; Orlando; Miami; Detroit; Chicago; Los Angeles and San Diego using local radio and television advertising.
She said there are also billboards in all areas except Chicago and a national campaign in Gannett Co Inc's USA Today. ((-- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.))
